Class Permutations

  • java.lang.Object
    • Permutations

  • public class Permutations
extends java.lang.Object
    Show all permutations of a list of items The items are names of image files (of emojis) Displays each possible permutation as a column of images. If there are too many for the screen, it highlights and keeps replacing the last column. For the core, you only have to write one method - the extendPermutations(...) method which does the recursive search.

      Finds all the permutations using an iterative method, found here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heap%27s_algorithm It prints the first one out manually, then finds all permuations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Permutations

        public Permutations()
        Construct a new Permutations object, setting up the GUI

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the display of permutations and resets the nextCol back to 2. (the current permutation search continues running).

      • display

        public void display(java.util.List<java.lang.String> items)
        Display a list of images in the next column. The list should have the names of the image files. Uses the field nextCol to specify where the column is. If there is room, it then moves to the next column, but if it is already at the end of the window, it highlights the column and draws over previous list (with a slight delay)

      • doMouse

        public void doMouse(java.lang.String action,
                    double x,
                    double y)
        Select an image to add to the list to permute

      • extendPermutation

        public void extendPermutation(java.util.List<java.lang.String> permutationSoFar,
                              java.util.Set<java.lang.String> remaining)
        Recursive method to build all permutations possible by adding the remaining items on to the end of the permutation built up so far If there are no remaining items, then permutationSoFar is complete, so display permutationSoFar and increment permutationCount. Use the display(...) method to display a permutation Otherwise, for each of the remaining items, Extend the permutation with one of the item, and do a recursive call to extend it more - remove the item from remaining items - add it to the permutation so far - do the recursive call - remove the item from the end of the permutation and - put it back into the remaining items. Remember: you can't modify a collection that you are currently iterating through!! you may need to make a copy of the remaining items to iterate through it.

      • findPermutations

        public void findPermutations()
        Finds and prints all permutations of the items in selectedList, by calling a recursive method, passing in a set of the items to permute and an empty list to build up. Prints the total number of permutations in the message window (with UI.printMessage(...);

      • findPermutationsIterative

        public void findPermutationsIterative(java.util.List<java.lang.String> permutationSoFar)
        Finds all the permutations using an iterative method, found here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heap%27s_algorithm It prints the first one out manually, then finds all permuations.

      • findPermutationsIterativeHelper

        public void findPermutationsIterativeHelper()
        Finds and prints all permutations of the items in selectedList, by calling a recursive method, passing in a set of the items to permute and an empty list to build up. Prints the total number of permutations in the message window (with UI.printMessage(...);

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] arguments)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the selection and redisplay. Clears all the current permutations (but doesn't stop the current permutation search if it is running).

      • setupGUI

        public void setupGUI()
        Buttons to reset and run permutations. Mouse to select images to permute
